result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. DNA surcharge is waived as no sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

***12-22-15/ Judge Janet C Protasiewicz**
The Court ordered that the defendant's request to transfer service of her sentence to Waukesha County is granted provided she is accepted.                        **

Huber privileges for work, treatment and visits with the children, pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply. Defendant ordered to report on 10-19-2015; failure to report will result in straight time. Credit for 2 days time served.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Follow all Childrens Court and MBCW orders.
-Visitation with the children to comply with CHIPS orders.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Follow all Childrens Court and MBCW orders.
-Visitation with the children to comply with CHIPS orders.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  DNA surcharge is waived as no sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges for work, treatment and visits with the children, pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant ordered to report on 10/19/15; failure to report will result in straight time. 

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court modified the no contact order to a No Violent Contact order.

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1,2 AND 3 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.  rmm
to Adjourn Jury Trial received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Attorney Cleghorn has a family emergency.  With no objection from the state, Court granted the request to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Final Pre-trial held. For reasons stated on the record, Court granted State's motion for an adjourned jury trial date. Court order jury trial date of 05/11/2015 vacated and a new date was selected.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Same conditions to apply.

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court reinstated the 5/11/15 jury trial date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  The 5/11/15 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JM, TB, CK, GHM, HHM, and AHM except as authorized by the Bureau of Child Welfare.

Defendant Stephanie Ashley Pichler in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty as to Count 3. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/20/15 @ 1:30pm
